title: Intro to Coffee & Coding
author: Matt Kerlogue
abstract: Discussing what we want to get out of Coffee & Coding the results of our interest survey and a demo of an interactive map of civil servants.

title: Making charts in R with ggplot & govstyle
author: Matt Kerlogue
abstract: An introduction to making charts using the R packages {ggplot2} and {govstyle}.

title: Tidy Tuesday
author: Duncan Garmonsway
abstract: This week we will have our very own Tidy Tuesday screencast: Duncan Garmonsway will try to analyse an unseen dataset using R and RStudio, and hopefully demonstrate some handy techniques.

title: Make an R package the easy way
author: Matt Dray
abstract: R packages: when should you make one and how do you do it? Matt Dray will live-build a minimal package with {usethis}, a package that greatly simplifies the process.

title: Automating reports with RMarkdown
author: Ben Vigreux
abstract: What is R Markdown? When would you want to use it? And how do you go about creating your first R Markdown report? Ben Vigreux from the Government Equalities Office (GEO) will run through a simple example to demonstrate this powerful format.

title: Introduction to mapping in R (1): static maps
author: Matt Kerlogue
abstract: To coincide with the 2019 Geography in Government conference, an introduction to using R for statistical mapping in {ggplot2}.
